system_prompt: Your goal is to generate triplets, each separated by a comma .

common-sens.prompt_suffix: knowing knowledge triplets that describe commonsense relation

spatial.prompt_suffix: spatial triplets that describe spatial relationship between objects or entities

temporal.prompt_suffix: temporal triplets that describe the temporal relationship between events or states

causal.prompt_suffix: causal triplets that describe cause and effect relationships

functional.prompt_suffix: functional triplets that describe the function or role of an object or entity

antonymy.prompt_suffix: antonymy triplets that describe opposite concepts or entities

synonymy.prompt_suffix: synonymy triplets that describe similar or identical concepts

meronymy.prompt_suffix: meronymy triplets that describe part-whole relationships
examples: petal, is a part of, flower
tire, is a component of, bicycle
wheel, is a component of, car

collocation.prompt_suffix: collocation triplets that describe words that frequently occur together

troponymy.prompt_suffix: troponymy triplets that describe specific ways in which an action is performed
examples: whisper, is a way to, speak
jog, is a way to, run
chuckle, is a way to, laugh
scribble, is a way to, write
slouch, is a way to, sit

hyponymy.prompt_suffix: hyponymy triplets that describe the relationship where one term is a subtype or a specific instance of another
examples: terrier, is a type of, dog
tulip, is a kind of, flower
oak, is a species of, tree
Honda, is a brand of, car
thriller, is a genre of, movie

hypernymy.prompt_suffix: hypernymy triplets that describe the relationship where one term encompasses a broader category to which the other belongs
examples: dog, is a general term for, terrier

entailment.prompt_suffix: entailment triplets that describe logical relationships where one concept or action logically infers another
examples: to sleep, entails, to be tired
to eat, entails, to be hungry
to rain, entails, to carry an umbrella
to drive, entails, having a license

attribute.prompt_suffix: attribute triplets that describe inherent properties or qualities of objects or entities

member-collection.prompt_suffix: member-collection triplets that describe the relationship between an individual item and the group to which it belongs

similarity.prompt_suffix: similarity triplets that describe the likeness or analogies between different concepts or entities
examples: tree, similar to, lungs of the Earth
